intro: Carum dissectum, commonly known as dissected caraway, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely dissected leaves that resemble those of parsley or dill. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its aromatic seeds are used in culinary and medicinal applications. Carum dissectum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and woodland edges.
